name: Medicine for Mayhem
description: The ensigns, under the command of Doctor T'Ana, return to the Cerritos from a surprisingly uneventful away mission, only to find the crew under the influence of some powerful parasites. Help them treat the problem - and avoid making it worse.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Mariner, Boimler, T'Ana, Tendi or Physicians will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Mariner, Boimler, T'Ana, Tendi or Physicians
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Maddox
featured_crew.flavor: In pursuit of the truth, Maddox finds himself hunted by the Tal Shiar and chained by debt. His life on the run may be in greater danger than he realizes.

featured_crew.name: Boimler
featured_crew.flavor: Boimler joins the crew of the USS Titan, where he is promoted to lieutenant junior grade.

action.name: I Don’t Have To Write That Down

featured_crew.name: Mariner
featured_crew.flavor: Overindulging on Romulan ale, Mariner gets carried away with a bat’leth.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Phlox
rewards.flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the Enterprise, Phlox was a lifelong learner of every medical art.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

rewards.name: T'Ana
rewards.flavor: The CMO of USS Cerritos. She has a dry wit and terse bedside manner, but is a trusted doctor to the crew.

rewards.name: Maddox
rewards.flavor: In pursuit of the truth, Maddox finds himself hunted by the Tal Shiar and chained by debt. His life on the run may be in greater danger than he realizes.

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Maddox
rewards.flavor: In pursuit of the truth, Maddox finds himself hunted by the Tal Shiar and chained by debt. His life on the run may be in greater danger than he realizes.

rewards.name: Mariner
rewards.flavor: Overindulging on Romulan ale, Mariner gets carried away with a bat’leth.

adventures.name: Stow Away Source
adventures.description: All right, who brought nasty parasites back with them?

adventures.name: Research the Specimen
adventures.description: 10 latinum per article? No way! Hack the Academy database!

adventures.description: Which crew members do the parasites find tastiest?

adventures.description: Find a way to deal with the parasites without killing them.

action.name: I Don’t Have To Write That Down

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Find the diplomatic answer with the Federation.
Find the most lucrative way with the Ferengi Alliance.

screens.text: "Well, consider me impressed. You all managed to collect enough Centauri primrose to keep my synthesis stores stocked for a good while. And the fact that you did it without causing any diplomatic conflicts or planetary catastrophes is a miracle all its own."

"So of course the crew had to get infected with parasites. While I'm tending the crew here, I'll need you all to gather more supplies and deal with the parasites themselves. But sending you all alone...may not be the best call. That's why I'm hoping the Captain here can help."
"Oh yeah, Doc, you know you can count on us. And luckily the Captain is here to make sure we don't get into any trouble."
"I guess we don't have any other choice. I'm counting on you all."

"Well, consider me impressed. You all managed to collect enough Centauri primrose to keep my synthesis stores stocked for a good while. And the fact that you did it without causing any diplomatic conflicts or planetary catastrophes is a miracle all its own."

"So of course the crew had to get infected with parasites. While I'm tending the crew here, I'll need you all to gather more supplies and deal with the parasites themselves. But sending you all alone...may not be the best call. That's why I'm hoping the Captain here can help."
"Oh yeah, Doc, you know you can count on us. And luckily the Captain is here to make sure we don't get into any trouble."
"I guess we don't have any other choice. I'm counting on you all."
"Well done collecting resources to remove the parasites. Unfortunately, you will not be needing them. We have no intention of departing our hosts. For if we do, we will surely die."

"Great, so now Dr T'Ana has a parasite in her too. Well, sorry about your luck, but parasite survival matters less than the lives of our crew, even in Starfleet. Now give back our Chief Medical Officer."

"Actually parasite survival is EQUALLY important to crew survival. Trill threatened to leave the Federation if that wasn't added to the bylaws. We call it 'The Redshirt Law' 'cause they're usually the ones XOs send down to parasite-ridden planets like canaries in a mine."

responses.text: "We prioritize the safety of the crew."
"Both the parasites and crew are equal. We need to find a way for both to live."
"Well, looks like the Cerritos belongs to the parasites now!"

screens.text: "That's...horrible. ANYWAY, ahem, Captain, maybe you can help us since Doctor T'Ana's out of commission. What do we do?"
"Right. We need to extract the parasites and ensure the crew all get back to normal. And we can start with the doctor here."

Yeah. I mean, don't get me wrong, there are definitely certain Andorians we could probably just dump off on the planet, parasites and all, but we should probably find some compromise, because Starfleet I guess.
"We have already renamed this vessel. However, there are some disputes, as our ranks do not match those of our host bodies. Perhaps you can help us settle that dispute."
"We'll handle things here and make sure no one gets killed or eaten. We're counting on you to help us find a permanent solution!
"Well done collecting resources to remove the parasites. Unfortunately, you will not be needing them. We have no intention of departing our hosts. For if we do, we will surely die."

"Great, so now Dr T'Ana has a parasite in her too. Well, sorry about your luck, but parasite survival matters less than the lives of our crew, even in Starfleet. Now give back our Chief Medical Officer."

"Actually parasite survival is EQUALLY important to crew survival. Trill threatened to leave the Federation if that wasn't added to the bylaws. We call it 'The Redshirt Law' 'cause they're usually the ones XOs send down to parasite-ridden planets like canaries in a mine."

responses.text: "We prioritize the safety of the crew."
"Both the parasites and crew are equal. We need to find a way for both to live."
"Well, looks like the Cerritos belongs to the parasites now!"

screens.text: "That's...horrible. ANYWAY, ahem, Captain, maybe you can help us since Doctor T'Ana's out of commission. What do we do?"
"Right. We need to extract the parasites and ensure the crew all get back to normal. And we can start with the doctor here."

Yeah. I mean, don't get me wrong, there are definitely certain Andorians we could probably just dump off on the planet, parasites and all, but we should probably find some compromise, because Starfleet I guess.
"We have already renamed this vessel. However, there are some disputes, as our ranks do not match those of our host bodies. Perhaps you can help us settle that dispute."
"We'll handle things here and make sure no one gets killed or eaten. We're counting on you to help us find a permanent solution!
